abstractText: The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdayā, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī/Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This incomplete paper manuscript, probably to be ascribed to the 18th or 19th century, contains the end of the Uṣṇīṣavijayā, the whole text of the Parṇaśavarī and the beginning of the Mārīcī.
